If your goal is to be able to manage not just members of a list, but
lists =
themselves, the easiest solution is to model the list as a
member of a coll=
ection, too.

Then your first step would be to add a new list to the list c=
ollection:

*** REQUEST
POST /lists/
host: www.example.org
content-type: ap=
plication/x-www-form-urlencoded
slug: services

creator=3Dmike&description=
=3Dlist+of+services

*** RESPONSE
201 Created
Location: http://www.example.=
org/lists/services

By modeling the list collection, you can apply operatio=
ns directly to
the collection including updating list member details (PUT),=
 removing
a list (DELETE) and you can use POST to model more complex tasks
=
including moving or copying lists or list contents (if you media-type
allow=
s such things)
